mainNavbar.name: GNSS
mainNavbar.title: GNSS Technology: Precision Positioning
mainNavbar.description: GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) refers to satellite systems such as GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, and BeiDou working together to provide precise global positioning, speed, and timing data. With RTK and PPP technologies, centimeter-level accuracy can be achieved. GNSS plays a critical role in construction, surveying, agriculture, mining, maritime operations, transportation, smart city applications, and autonomous systems. GNSS receivers deliver reliable data even in harsh field conditions, with real-time data transfer, high satellite tracking capacity, and durable designs for both mobile and fixed applications.

mainNavbar.name: TOTAL STATION
mainNavbar.title: Total Station Technology: Professional Measurement Devices
mainNavbar.description: Total Station devices combine laser, electronic angle, and distance measurement technologies to enable fast and precise data collection on-site. With features like automatic target recognition, prism tracking, and remote data transmission, they are essential in major construction and engineering projects. They ensure seamless data transfer to CAD and BIM systems, error-free measurements, quick data logging, and real-time verification. Total Stations provide sub-centimeter accuracy for bridge constructions, highway projects, tunnel excavations, and dam works.

mainNavbar.name: UAV
mainNavbar.title: UAV Technology: Aerial Imaging and Mapping
mainNavbar.description: Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) are used in high-resolution imaging, orthophoto production, and 3D modeling. They enable fast and efficient data collection in challenging terrains. Integrated with GNSS, lidar, and multispectral cameras, UAVs are used in sectors like agriculture, mining, construction, and disaster management. They support automatic flight planning, data collection over pre-defined routes, and live monitoring during flights.

mainNavbar.name: LIDAR
mainNavbar.title: LiDAR Technology: High-Precision 3D Scanning
mainNavbar.description: LiDAR (Light Detection and Ranging) is an advanced technology that uses laser beams to create 3D point clouds of surfaces. Mounted on aerial or ground vehicles, it collects data with millimeter precision over large areas. Ideal for forestry, road projects, infrastructure planning, city modeling, and mining applications.

mainNavbar.name: LEVEL INSTRUMENT
mainNavbar.title: Leveling Technology: Accurate Elevation Measurement
mainNavbar.description: Leveling instruments are used in construction, infrastructure, and engineering projects to measure height differences with high precision. They come in optical and digital models. Digital levels automatically calculate and display measurements on-screen for quick and reliable use in site applications.

mainNavbar.name: BATHYMETRY
mainNavbar.title: Bathymetry Technology: Underwater Mapping and Depth Measurement
mainNavbar.description: Bathymetry is used to measure underwater surface depths and produce topographic maps. Equipped with single-beam and multi-beam sonar systems, bathymetry equipment is essential for dam reservoirs, harbors, rivers, and marine studies.

mainNavbar.name: MACHINE CONTROL
mainNavbar.title: Machine Control Technology: Site Automation and Precision Excavation
mainNavbar.description: Machine control systems are integrated into heavy machinery like excavators, dozers, and graders for automatic excavation and filling with millimeter accuracy. These technologies reduce errors, save labor costs, and shorten project durations by allowing direct application of 3D project data on site.

mainNavbar.name: SENSOR
mainNavbar.title: Sensor Technology: Smart Monitoring and Data Collection Systems
mainNavbar.description: Sensor systems collect and process real-time environmental and structural data such as temperature, humidity, pressure, inclination, movement, and vibration. Widely used in structural health monitoring, geotechnical observation, environmental studies, and industrial applications.

mainNavbar.name: SOFTWARE
mainNavbar.title: Software Technology: Data Analysis, Mapping, and Reporting
mainNavbar.description: Mapping, data analysis, and reporting software are used to process data from GNSS, LiDAR, UAV, and bathymetry systems quickly and accurately. They offer features like 3D modeling, surface analysis, volume calculations, and ortho-image production.

mainNavbar.name: ACCESSORIES
mainNavbar.title: Accessory Technology: Supporting Solutions
mainNavbar.description: Accessories such as batteries, tripods, prism sets, data cables, and carrying cases designed for GNSS, LiDAR, UAV, and total station devices increase field efficiency. High-quality, durable materials ensure long-lasting performance even under tough conditions.

left.title: Millimeter-Level High Accuracy
left.slogan: Ultra precision with RTK and multi-frequency
left.text: GNSS systems provide millimeter-level accuracy with RTK and PPK support. It offers top performance for positioning in precision engineering projects.

left.title: Uninterrupted Operation and Reliable Data Flow
left.text: GNSS devices ensure uninterrupted data collection even in harsh environmental conditions thanks to multi-satellite tracking and backup systems.

left.title: Quick Fix
left.text: Advanced GNSS systems achieve position fix within seconds, saving time and increasing field productivity.

left.title: Portability and Lightweight Design
left.slogan: Always with you in the field
left.text: GNSS receivers offer easy portability and ergonomic use in the field with their compact and lightweight design.

left.title: Long Battery Life and Energy Efficiency
left.text: With a battery life of up to 12-24 hours, GNSS systems allow for long-term measurements and data collection in the field.

left.title: Easy Integration and Platform Compatibility
left.text: GNSS systems work in integration with different software and platforms, accelerating data transfer and analysis processes.

right.title: Key Application Areas
right.text: High accuracy is a critical advantage in infrastructure projects and applications that require precise measurements.

right.title: Key Application Areas
right.text: Uninterrupted operation provides reliability in long-term field tasks and areas where continuous data flow is crucial.

right.title: Key Application Areas
right.text: Quick fix feature offers great convenience in projects racing against time and applications requiring instant data.

right.title: Key Application Areas
right.text: Portability provides maximum flexibility for projects that require constant site changes and mobile operations.

right.title: Key Application Areas
right.text: Long battery life is an advantage in large-scale projects where uninterrupted data collection is essential.

right.title: Key Application Areas
right.text: Easy integration stands out in complex projects that require data management and multi-system usage.

left.title: Millimeter-Level Precision Measurement
left.text: Total Station devices provide millimeter-level precision in horizontal and vertical angle and distance measurements. This feature is critically important in construction, infrastructure, and engineering projects.

left.title: Fast and Automatic Target Tracking

pageSections.title: We Are Everywhere in Turkey!
pageSections.subtitle: We are very happy to meet you!
pageSections.description: We cover all 81 provinces: Over 3,000 surveying companies, more than 500 municipalities, over 1,000 government institutions, more than 800 construction companies, over 110 energy companies, and more than 130 universities are among our references.
paragraphs: With years of experience and our expert team, we provide the right solutions whenever you need them. From product supply to technical support, we are with you every step of the way. To learn more about GNSS Teknik’s working principles and the value we offer, visit our About Us page.

pageSections.title: Measurement and Data Collection Solutions for Every Field!
pageSections.subtitle: GNSS, LiDAR and More!
pageSections.description: We offer solutions for every project with our GNSS, total station, UAV, LiDAR, level instrument, bathymetry, machine control, sensor, software, and accessories categories.

With our complementary systems, you can find everything you need for land, marine measurements, and automation projects in our categories.

pageSections.title: Discover Our New Marketing Website!
pageSections.subtitle: Surveying and Technology Solutions
pageSections.description: Speed up your business processes with our surveying and advanced technology solutions. With our new marketing website, you can easily discover solutions tailored to your needs in a faster and more effective way.
paragraphs: Our mapping solutions cover satellite, LiDAR, and GNSS technologies. With our team of expert engineers, we provide the most up-to-date and precise data for both individual and corporate clients.

On our new marketing website, you can find detailed product categories and recommendations by usage areas for different industries. Thanks to comprehensive product information and comparison tables, you can easily select the solutions that best meet your needs. Moreover, with our after-sales support and training services, we ensure the highest level of user experience.

aboutUs.title: About Us
paragraphs: Our company was established in 2008 and underwent a restructuring in 2012 to collaborate with CHCNAV, a manufacturer of GNSS technologies. During the same period, we reached an agreement with BHC, a company offering handheld GNSS solutions, becoming their authorized dealer in Turkey. For mobile GBS (GIS) solutions, we engaged in discussions with Digiterra, expanding our software product range to provide comprehensive spatial solutions. In 2019, we were authorized as a dealer for DJI Enterprise and subsequently added 3D Survey Photo Evaluation and Map Production software to our product portfolio. We also offer terrestrial measurement instruments such as Total Stations and levels. As GNSS technologies continued to evolve rapidly, we secured all major GNSS tenders conducted in Turkey during that period, strengthening our position in the industry. To ensure 100% customer satisfaction, we expanded our team, opened new branches, and implemented TSE-certified service. Over the years, we have rapidly ascended in the Turkish GNSS market, ranking among the top three companies in terms of revenue and achieving leadership in sales volume. In the fields of positioning, navigation, and mapping, we offer solutions including GNSS, INS, Reference Stations, RTK tablets, and mobile GNSS solutions. Additionally, we provide comprehensive solutions involving Bathymetry, Unmanned Surface Vehicles, Total Stations and Robotic Systems, Deformation Solutions, Unmanned Aerial Vehicles, and software solutions, culminating in Lidar technologies.

vision.title: Our Vision
paragraphs: We are with you under all circumstances...

To be the most preferred company by our target audience, creating difference with competitive products; ensuring permanence with quality and sustainable service approach; adding value with the brands we represent and becoming a leading company in our sector.

mission.title: Our Mission
paragraphs: We exist to provide the highest value to our customers.

As GNSS Teknik, with our experienced and expert staff, we aim to produce comprehensive solutions in the fields of surveying and engineering, mobile mapping and geospatial, hydrographic surveys and construction, navigation and infrastructure; and to provide sales, after-sales, and technical support services at the highest level.

values.title: Our Values
paragraphs: To realize our vision, we shape all our work with the principles of passion, honesty, entrepreneurship, and innovation. These values not only guide our path but also define our corporate culture.

Key to Success: We closely follow evolving technologies, offering our users the newest and most effective solutions with our expert team. We aim to brand ourselves in Turkey and our representations, continuously adding value to our own brand.
Awareness: We believe in the power of personal development, advancing both ourselves and our customers through personal awareness. We analyze needs correctly and produce solutions with dedication.

Innovation and Open-Minded Approach: To adapt to our customers' changing expectations, we develop innovative, dynamic, and rational solutions. We place continuous improvement at the center of our projects with advanced technology and strong management understanding.

Trust and Sincerity: Reliability and honesty are our most valuable principles. As GNSS Teknik, we establish sincere relationships in every project, building long-term trust. Establishing strong and lasting bonds with our customers is our top priority.

senceiveIntro.title: Senceive: Global Leader in Reliable and Smart Monitoring Technology
senceiveIntro.text: Represented by GNSS Teknoloji, Senceive stands out with its high-precision, robust and reliable remote monitoring solutions developed specifically for the demanding conditions of civil engineering, railways and mining. These systems support infrastructure teams to make timely and accurate decisions during construction and maintenance activities.

senceiveIntro.title: A Pioneer Brand in Field Monitoring
senceiveIntro.text: Since 2005, Senceive has been one of the first companies to integrate wireless condition monitoring technologies into the construction and railway industries. This long-standing experience has made it one of the most trusted and established firms in the sector.

senceiveIntro.title: Customer-Focused R&D Approach
senceiveIntro.text: Founded in University College London (UCL) research labs, Senceive has operated with a customer-oriented mindset from the beginning. This approach is reflected in all processes, from product development to technical support.

senceiveIntro.title: Innovation Driven by Engineering
senceiveIntro.text: Engineering lies at the heart of Senceive’s growth strategy. The solutions are shaped by real-world engineering experience and field-tested performance. This technical competency ensures the continuity of innovative products.

senceiveIntro.title: Global Scale Reliability
senceiveIntro.text: Today, Senceive is a global leader in wireless remote monitoring with more than 80,000 sensor deployments worldwide. As GNSS Teknoloji, we are proud to represent this powerful brand across Turkey and the region.

senceiveTechnologies.title: FlatMesh
senceiveTechnologies.subTitle: What is FlatMesh?
senceiveTechnologies.description: FlatMesh is Senceive’s first-generation wireless monitoring system. It offers flexible and robust infrastructure.
senceiveTechnologies.details: FlatMesh is a wireless monitoring system integrating multiple sensors. It collects data with high accuracy and eliminates the need for wiring. It performs exceptionally well in confined and harsh environments.

senceiveTechnologies.title: GeoWAN (LoRa)
senceiveTechnologies.subTitle: What is GeoWAN?
senceiveTechnologies.description: GeoWAN provides long-range data transmission with low power consumption in wide areas.
senceiveTechnologies.details: GeoWAN is a long-range and low-power wireless monitoring system operating on the LoRa protocol. It ensures reliable data transmission for large-scale projects.

sectorDetails.title: Railway Systems Monitoring
sectorDetails.summary: Railway systems are the cornerstone of modern transportation and the backbone of national logistics strategies. From high-speed rail lines to metro systems, light rail to commuter lines, every level of infrastructure is shaped by the need for safe, uninterrupted, and long-term operation. These infrastructures are constantly at risk due to both natural factors (ground movement, precipitation, temperature changes) and artificial effects (heavy traffic loads, construction activities, aging structural elements). Therefore, comprehensive and continuous monitoring of railway infrastructure is critical not only for maintenance planning, but also for passenger safety, environmental risk management, and legal compliance. Senceive’s wireless sensor systems are state-of-the-art solutions developed to meet these challenges. With real-time monitoring, automatic alarm notifications, remote access for intervention, and long-term data archiving capabilities, they offer railway engineers unlimited control.
sectorDetails.overview: The safety and performance of rail systems are not only related to the track itself but also to surrounding structures, geotechnical conditions, and even seasonal variations. Traditional monitoring methods usually provide periodic measurements instead of real-time data, making early warning systems insufficient. Yet, issues like track deformation, tunnel segment separation, or sudden slope changes in switch systems can pose major risks even with a few minutes of delay. This is where Senceive steps in: low-power wireless sensor nodes, connected to each other, measure parameters such as tilt, displacement, temperature, and strain simultaneously and transmit them to the cloud via gateways. The system provides maximum data access with minimal human intervention across all types of rail structures, from metro tunnels to high-speed lines. Users can analyze measurement results through advanced visualization interfaces, define threshold values, and set up automatic alarms based on specific scenarios. This creates a proactive rather than reactive maintenance model. Moreover, the system is compatible with existing infrastructure through integration with SCADA systems and third-party software. Designed to operate reliably even in harsh environments such as high humidity, intense electromagnetic fields, or narrow spaces, the system has an IP68+ protection rating and marks a new era in railway engineering.

howItWorks.description: Senceive’s rail monitoring solutions operate through the integration of a multi-layer sensor network, energy management infrastructure, and a cloud-based software platform. Each monitoring point features sensor nodes (tilt, displacement, temperature, strain) with IP68-rated enclosures suitable for harsh field conditions. These sensors can be installed on rails, sleepers, switch boxes, or retaining walls within minutes. They collect data at defined intervals (e.g., every minute) and transmit it via LoRa, GSM, or RF to gateways. The gateways then send the data to secure, always-on cloud servers. Users access this data through Senceive's Insight platform, which provides multi-graph views, comparative analytics, real-time sensor tracking, and alarm notifications via email/SMS. Automated actions can also be defined for specific events (e.g., when a sensor threshold is exceeded), such as data sharing, third-party system integration (e.g., SCADA, GIS), or triggering video recording. Thanks to solar-powered gateways, the system can operate continuously for years in mountainous, rural, or tunnel environments without the need for external power. Depending on measurement frequency and environmental conditions, battery life ranges from 8 to 15 years. Maintenance needs are minimal, and the system can be updated remotely, including firmware updates. This allows new features to be added or network management to be optimized without going on-site.

benefits: Thanks to real-time monitoring and automatic alarm mechanisms, safety issues can be detected before they arise, enabling preventive intervention.
Installation does not require cables or excavation, saving time and avoiding damage to existing infrastructure.
High-frequency measurements (e.g., every minute) provide a major advantage in detecting the real-time behavior of dynamic structures.
Long battery life (up to 15 years) ensures uninterrupted operation in long-term projects, significantly reducing maintenance costs.
The industrial-grade design withstands harsh climate and environmental conditions, operating continuously from -40°C to +85°C.
Integration with SCADA, GIS, and proprietary data management systems enables centralized control across the entire infrastructure.
Advanced software interfaces allow users not only to analyze but also to visualize, report, and export data.
Proven and certified technology used in over 10,000 field applications worldwide, actively deployed by national rail authorities.

sectorDetails.title: Construction Site Monitoring
sectorDetails.summary: Construction sites are high-risk environments with constantly changing conditions. Both temporary structures and permanent foundations are affected by load shifts, underground movements, excavation operations, and heavy machinery—all of which pose safety and structural risks. Senceive’s wireless sensor networks provide real-time data at every stage of construction, enabling contractors, engineers, and project managers to make faster, safer, and more effective decisions. This ensures both worker safety and proactive management of structural risks.
sectorDetails.overview: Traditional monitoring methods often rely on manual measurements, periodic inspections, and delayed feedback. However, in modern construction sites where even minutes are critical, these approaches fall short. Dynamic zones such as excavation support systems, temporary scaffolding, piling structures, and superstructure assemblies require continuous monitoring, instant analysis, and automatic alert systems. Senceive’s energy-efficient, IP68-rated wireless sensors (tilt, displacement, temperature, strain, etc.) can be integrated within seconds onto any surface (wall, pile head, retaining structure). After installation, data is transmitted wirelessly to a gateway via LoRa, GSM, or RF technology, then sent to the cloud. The Insight platform presents this data in graphical, comparative, and geolocation-based formats. Users can define automatic alarms based on threshold values, integrate with third-party systems, and share data in real-time. These systems can operate continuously in urban projects, tunnel boring operations, or mega infrastructure sites—offering digital oversight without requiring physical site access.

howItWorks.description: Senceive platforms consist of a series of wireless sensor nodes, energy management systems, and a cloud-based software infrastructure. Each sensor (e.g., tiltmeters, strain gauges, temperature sensors) can be easily mounted to critical or risky areas of the site (excavation walls, temporary scaffolds, crane foundations, pile heads). These sensors collect data at defined intervals (e.g., once per minute) and wirelessly transmit it to a nearby gateway. The gateway then relays the data to secure cloud servers via GSM, LoRaWAN, or satellite connection. On the platform, users monitor this data using graphs, comparative analytics, and geolocation-based visualizations. SMS/email alerts are sent when threshold values are exceeded, and SCADA or other existing systems can trigger automated responses. Thanks to solar-powered gateways, the system can operate without any need for field-based energy infrastructure. Battery life ranges from 10 to 15 years on average. The entire system, including firmware updates, can be managed remotely, enabling updates or new features without on-site intervention.

benefits: Sensor structure requires no cabling or energy infrastructure, allowing full setup within minutes—saving both time and cost.
Real-time data flow enables early detection and preventive action for risks like excavation collapse, anchor loosening, or wall deformation.
Durable, IP68-certified sensor design ensures reliable data from -40°C to +85°C in harsh site conditions.
Alarm system and email/SMS notifications allow technical teams off-site to be instantly informed and involved.
Integration with SCADA, BIM, and other monitoring platforms enables centralized archiving and analysis of project data.
Provides a versatile sensor network suitable for monitoring structural health, evaluating temporary structures, and analyzing foundation settlements.
Minimizes manual measurements and hazardous site visits, enhancing safety and reducing workforce burden.
Scalable and easily adaptable to all types of sites, from small-scale housing projects to large-scale highway bridge constructions.

sectorDetails.title: Mining and Quarry Monitoring
sectorDetails.summary: Mining is a large-scale, high-risk industrial activity that involves the extraction of both surface and underground resources. Among the greatest challenges faced during these operations are ground instability, sudden deformations from blasting activities, roof collapses, landslides, weakening of tailings dams, and structural damage. Senceive’s wireless monitoring systems are specifically designed for these dynamic and hazardous environments. Robust sensor nodes monitor the behavior of critical structures in mining sites with millimetric precision. They collect real-time data particularly from slopes, tunnels, shafts, and dams. This enhances worker safety and maximizes operational efficiency. Thanks to remote access to field data, a continuous flow of information is maintained between engineers and field teams. Senceive solutions reduce maintenance costs, minimize downtime, and help prevent potential disasters. Moreover, with solar-powered gateways, reliable long-term monitoring is possible even without energy infrastructure.
sectorDetails.overview: Traditional mining monitoring methods typically rely on periodic measurements and limited manual observations. This approach is insufficient for sudden events and often only allows intervention after damage has occurred. However, in mining—an ever-changing environment—real-time, continuous information is essential, not just historical data. Senceive’s wireless and energy-efficient sensor networks perfectly meet this need. They can simultaneously monitor parameters such as slope stability, surface movements, tunnel deformations, convergence movements, and tailings dam pressure variations. Moreover, since these systems operate over LoRa, RF, or GSM connections, they provide uninterrupted communication even in sites spanning large areas. The Insight platform processes all incoming data in real time, generating meaningful graphs, comparative analyses, and alert systems. It can also automatically send SMS or email notifications when thresholds are exceeded. With camera integration, event verification becomes possible. All these features enable mining engineers not only to monitor the current state but also to foresee potential risks—creating a proactive, not just reactive, monitoring model.

howItWorks.description: Senceive’s mining solutions are based on an integrated monitoring system composed of sensors, gateways, and a platform. Each sensor node is equipped with high-precision hardware capable of measuring critical parameters such as tilt, displacement, temperature, and strain. Manufactured to IP68 standards, these sensors are designed to operate for years under harsh field conditions. They can be installed in predefined areas (e.g., open-pit slopes, shafts, tailings dam edges, tunnel openings) within minutes. Once installed, the sensors collect data at the configured frequency (e.g., every minute) and transmit it wirelessly to a nearby gateway. These gateways typically operate on solar power and transmit the data to the cloud-based Insight platform via LoRaWAN, GSM, or RF communication. The platform visualizes this data through time-based graphs, detects anomalies, and generates alerts when necessary. Users can define threshold values and set up automatic integration with SCADA or third-party systems. The system can also be updated remotely, allowing the deployment of new sensor types or data algorithms without physical intervention. With minimal maintenance requirements, it can operate continuously for over 10 years.

benefits: Senceive’s robust IP68-rated sensors ensure uninterrupted operation even in challenging mining conditions such as high temperatures, humidity, dust, and explosive gases—guaranteeing field safety.
In high-risk open-pit and underground areas, the system collects data 24/7, providing instant alerts against collapses, deformations, or ground shifts for proactive intervention.
When sensors in the field reach predefined threshold values, automatic alarms are triggered to inform both onsite teams and remote managers—enabling fast response and risk reduction.
Thanks to the wireless communication infrastructure, there is no need to lay cables during installation—saving time and enabling easy deployment in rugged terrain.
Solar or battery-powered systems enable long-term, uninterrupted data collection even in remote areas without existing energy infrastructure.
The central monitoring platform aggregates data from multiple mining sites into a single interface, allowing comprehensive analysis and comparison for management teams.
With camera integration and compatibility with custom panels, the system supports visual verification and detailed reporting to improve understanding of events.
Long-lasting, maintenance-free sensor architecture reduces operating costs while increasing system reliability.

sectorDetails.title: Infrastructure and Critical Structure Monitoring
sectorDetails.summary: Critical structures such as bridges, tunnels, dams, waterways, pipelines, and energy infrastructures can become vulnerable over time due to environmental impacts, structural fatigue, and unforeseen events. These structures are vital for both public safety and economic continuity. Senceive’s wireless monitoring solutions are designed to track the long-term health and performance of such infrastructure. With real-time data collection, instant alerts, and long-lasting sensor technology, infrastructure owners and managers can detect potential issues early, take proactive measures, reduce maintenance costs, and extend the service life of their assets.
sectorDetails.overview: Traditional infrastructure monitoring methods often rely on periodic manual inspections and limited data collection. This approach may fall short when it comes to sudden events, often making it too late to act once problems are noticed. Senceive’s wireless monitoring systems overcome these shortcomings by providing continuous, reliable, and detailed data. The system helps understand structural behavior by tracking parameters such as tilt, displacement, temperature, and strain. Operating over LoRa, RF, or GSM connections, these systems provide uninterrupted communication even across widespread infrastructure. The Insight platform processes data from sensors in real time, generating meaningful graphs, comparative analyses, and alert systems. This allows infrastructure managers to continuously monitor performance, anticipate maintenance needs, and prevent potential failures.

howItWorks.description: Senceive’s infrastructure monitoring solutions are based on an integrated system consisting of sensor nodes, gateway devices, and a data management platform. Each sensor node is equipped with high-precision hardware capable of measuring parameters such as tilt, displacement, temperature, and strain. Manufactured to IP68 standards, these sensors are built to function for years even in harsh field conditions. They can be installed within minutes in predefined areas (e.g., bridge piers, tunnel walls, dam faces). Once installed, the sensors collect data at set intervals and wirelessly transmit it to the nearest gateway. These gateways typically operate on solar power and transmit the data to the cloud-based Insight platform via LoRaWAN, GSM, or RF communication. The platform visualizes this data through time-based graphs, detects anomalies, and generates alerts when necessary. Users can define threshold values and set up automatic integration with SCADA or other systems. The system can also be updated remotely, allowing new sensor types or data algorithms to be introduced without physical site intervention. With minimal maintenance requirements, the system can operate continuously for over 10 years.

benefits: Senceive’s robust IP68-rated sensors ensure uninterrupted operation even in extreme environmental conditions such as high temperature, humidity, dust, and more—guaranteeing infrastructure safety.
The system collects data 24/7 in critical infrastructure areas, enabling proactive response through instant alerts against potential deformation or structural degradation.
When sensors in the field reach predefined thresholds, automatic alarms are triggered to inform both on-site teams and remote managers, allowing for rapid intervention and risk reduction.
The wireless communication infrastructure eliminates the need for cable installation during setup, saving time and enabling easier deployment in difficult terrain.
Solar- or battery-powered systems enable long-term, uninterrupted data collection even in remote areas without existing energy infrastructure.
The central monitoring platform aggregates data from various infrastructure sites into a single interface, providing managers with comprehensive analysis and comparisons.
With camera integration and compatibility with specialized panels, the system supports visual verification and detailed reporting, improving understanding of incidents.
Long-lasting, maintenance-free sensor design lowers operating costs while enhancing system reliability.

applications.title: Rail Tracks
applications.description: Rail systems are infrastructures that must be constantly monitored due to high-frequency vibrations, dynamic load variations, and ground settlement. Senceive sensors detect problems such as rail deformation, track settlement, and sleeper displacement in real-time. With this system, track closure time is reduced, maintenance planning is optimized, and passenger safety is enhanced.

applications.title: Rockfalls
applications.description: In mountainous or sloped terrains, the risk of rockfall poses a serious structural and life safety threat. Senceive's wireless tilt sensors and movement monitors detect micro-movements to provide early warning of potential falls. This enables protection of roads, tunnels, or structures and allows safety measures to be taken in advance.

applications.title: Tunnels
applications.description: Deformations, convergence, segment gaps, and pressure changes occurring in underground tunnels threaten structural integrity. Senceive systems monitor these changes with millimetric precision. Thanks to alarm mechanisms integrated with SCADA systems, critical situations are instantly reported and operators can intervene quickly.

applications.title: Emergency Monitoring
applications.description: In emergencies such as earthquakes, landslides, and dam failures, monitoring the behavior of infrastructures is vital. Senceive enables the tracking of structural risks in emergency scenarios through real-time sensor data. With automatic alert generation and camera integration, instant decisions can be made and intervention teams directed.

applications.title: Slopes
applications.description: Slopes, hillsides, and soft ground areas are highly susceptible to landslides and soil slips. With Senceive inclinometers and remote monitoring systems, such movements are detected at an early stage. Long-term slope change analysis guides project design and reinforcement efforts.

applications.title: Bridges
applications.description: Bridge structures are constantly subject to effects such as thermal expansion, load changes, ground settlement, and vibrations. Senceive systems provide real-time data from bridge piers, decks, and suspension points, enabling structural health assessment. Long-term monitoring supports data-driven maintenance decisions.

applications.title: Pipelines
applications.description: Displacement, bending, deformation, or leaks in underground and surface pipelines pose serious environmental and financial threats. Senceive systems monitor structural behavior along the pipeline using strategically placed sensors, providing instant alerts when alarm thresholds are exceeded.

applications.title: Drainage Systems
applications.description: Due to heavy rainfall, channel blockages, or infrastructure weaknesses, drainage systems can pose a flood risk. Senceive's wireless monitoring solutions continuously track water level, flow rate, and pressure, providing municipalities and technical teams with real-time data. Thanks to alerts, preventive measures can be taken to avoid infrastructure damage.

intro.title: Global Technology Leader
intro.text: Founded in 2015 in Beijing, Benewake quickly gained worldwide recognition in the lidar sensor industry. It operates across a wide range of fields from smart city applications to autonomous systems. Today, it exports to over 80 countries and is a trusted partner in both industrial and academic projects. With strong R&D capabilities and international collaborations, it leads the evolution of sensor technology.

intro.title: Wide Product Range
intro.text: Benewake's product portfolio is diversified to meet varying range and precision needs. It offers numerous models from compact options like TF-Luna to long-range solutions like TF350. Each product is equipped with advantages such as IP protection, multiple interfaces (UART, CAN, RS485), and low power consumption. This flexibility allows easy integration across a wide range of industries.

intro.title: Innovative R&D and Patents
intro.text: To date, Benewake has filed over 300 national and international patents, establishing itself as a tech pioneer. It continuously advances in signal processing algorithms, optical structure optimization, and hardware development. In addition to its headquarters in China, it actively contributes to the global innovation cycle through partners in Europe and the United States. Its R&D budget forms a significant portion of its total revenue.

intro.title: Reliability and Durability
intro.text: With IP65 and IP67 protection class models, Benewake sensors offer reliable performance in harsh field conditions. They can operate in temperatures from -20°C to +70°C and are resistant to impacts and electromagnetic interference. During production, sensors undergo numerous environmental tests to ensure durability. These features provide long-lasting, low-maintenance solutions.

intro.title: Versatile Application Areas
intro.text: Benewake sensors are used for drone navigation, obstacle detection, in-vehicle safety systems, factory automation, agricultural robots, and more. The TF-Luna model stands out in fixed height control, while the TF02-Pro is prominent in obstacle detection. With high frequency and low power consumption, they ensure energy efficiency in all these applications. Thanks to their modular design, they can be easily integrated into both embedded systems and standalone solutions.

visualBlock.title: How Do Benewake Sensors Work?
paragraphs: Benewake sensors are high-precision distance measurement systems that operate using ToF (Time-of-Flight) technology. The sensor emits an infrared laser beam toward a target; the beam reflects off the target surface and returns, and the round-trip time is measured to calculate the distance with millimeter-level precision.

This principle enables the sensors to perform tasks with high accuracy such as fixed height tracking, terrain monitoring, and landing-takeoff control in drone systems. In robotic platforms, they provide direct input for obstacle detection and navigation. In autonomous vehicles, they contribute to collision avoidance and object recognition. In building automation, they are used for floor positioning, vehicle presence, and human motion detection.

Benewake sensors, with their compact design, low power consumption, IP protection rating, and various communication interfaces (UART, CAN, RS485), can be easily integrated into different systems. This makes them an ideal and long-lasting solution for applications ranging from mobile platforms to industrial automation.

productButtons.title: Single Point Series
productButtons.text: One-way distance measurement sensors for fast, lightweight, and cost-effective applications.

productButtons.title: 2D Series
productButtons.text: Offers two-dimensional measurement capabilities for surface scanning and wide-area analysis.

productButtons.title: 3D Series
productButtons.text: Ideal volumetric detection solutions for complex object recognition and environmental mapping applications.

kvkk.title: Privacy Notice Under the Personal Data Protection Law (KVKK)
kvkk.subtitle: GNSS Harita Teknik Danışmanlık Sanayi ve Ticaret A.Ş.

text.content: INFORMATION NOTICE ON WEBSITE COOKIE USAGE

As GNSS Harita Teknik Danışmanlık Sanayi ve Ticaret A.Ş. (GNSS TEKNİK), we show utmost sensitivity regarding the processing and protection of personal data belonging to visitors of www.gnssteknik.com.tr (the "Website") in accordance with Law No. 6698 on the Protection of Personal Data ("KVKK") and its secondary legislation.

Within the scope of our obligation to inform under the personal data protection legislation, we hereby present this “Information Notice on Website Cookie Usage” to inform you about the cookies used by our website and the personal data processed through them.
What Types of Cookies Do We Use?

Cookies are small text files created on your device by a website, containing data in name-value format. The cookies we use during your visit enable the storage of visit-related information on your device and allow us to access this information during your next visits.

Cookies created by our website and only readable by us are first-party cookies.

Content offered on our site may also be provided through domain names other than the access domain. In such cases, each domain name may generate its own third-party cookies.

The types of cookies we use and their intended purposes are listed below:

rows: These cookies are valid only during your use of the Website and remain active until you close your internet browser.
These cookies are stored in your browser and remain valid until you delete them or until their expiration date.
These cookies are required for the Website to function properly and to use its features and services.

These cookies are used to remember your behavior and preferences during your visit, ensure effective use of the Website, and optimize it to respond to your requests. These cookies may contain personal data depending on their nature. For example, your language preference for viewing the Website is processed via these cookies.

text.content: We aim to provide a more efficient and functional online experience with third-party cookies used on our Website. Personal data obtained by these service providers on behalf of GNSS is protected under the Data Privacy Agreement concluded between GNSS and the providers, in accordance with KVKK.

Cookies created by our site are stored on your computer by the web browser you use to access the Website. The information contained in these cookies can only be accessed remotely by the Website under the domain name www.gnssteknik.com.tr, and only if you use the same browser.

Your web browser generally accepts cookies automatically. Cookie usage is not mandatory to use our Website; however, if you configure your browser to block all cookies, the quality of your user experience may decrease, and you may not be able to access or benefit from certain features of our Website.

You can configure your browser to block cookies for all or certain websites, notify you when a cookie is created, block third-party cookies, or treat all cookies as session cookies.

You can also delete cookies stored on your device through your browser, view the list and values of these cookies, and track them. For more information about cookie management, please visit the links below for your browser:

Google Chrome

Mozilla Firefox

Safari

Microsoft Edge

For more information about cookies, you may visit www.aboutcookies.org and www.youronlinechoices.eu. These websites are in English.

Cookies are not used for purposes other than those specified in this Cookie Notice, and all relevant transactions are carried out in accordance with the KVKK. Personal data obtained through cookies is processed, stored, and secured by GNSS in accordance with KVKK.
Within the scope of Article 11 of the KVKK, you may contact GNSS and exercise your rights listed below:

items: To learn whether your personal data is being processed
To request information if your personal data has been processed
To learn the purpose of the processing and whether it is used in accordance with that purpose
To know the third parties to whom your personal data has been transferred domestically or abroad
To request the correction of personal data if it is incomplete or incorrectly processed
To request the deletion or destruction of personal data within the framework of the conditions set forth in Article 7
To request that third parties to whom the personal data has been transferred are notified of the corrections or deletions made under subparagraphs (d) and (e)
To object to a result that is against you, arising from the analysis of the processed data exclusively through automated systems
To demand compensation if you suffer damages due to the unlawful processing of personal data
